page.title: 05Cycling the School Bus Route
page.content: I cycled around the school bus route to find out how far people travelled to get to school. Mr Nicholls, the driver, brings the bus from Wormelow every morning. Richard is the first person to get on at 8.15 a.m. He travels 10.5 miles (16.8km) to get to school. Gavin gets on the bus 9 miles (14.4km) from the school at 8.20 a.m. Anthony and Clare meet the bus 8 miles (12.8km) away at 8.25 a.m. Matthew gets on at a point half a mile down the road. At 8.30 a.m. the bus reaches Pontrilas, 5.5 miles (8.8km) from school, and Emma and Darryl get on. Stephen meets the bus at Kentchurch, which is 3 miles (4.8km) from the school. It was very difficult cycling this route, as the hills are very steep and the road twists and turns.
